law.catch_line: Disciplinary actions -- Civil penalty -- Permanent file -- Assurance of voluntary compliance -- Appeal.

text.section: In addition to or in lieu of any other lawful disciplinary action under this section, the board may assess a civil penalty not exceeding two thousand dollars ($2,000).

When the board issues a written reprimand to the licensee a copy of the reprimand shall be placed in the permanent file of the licensee. The licensee shall have the right to submit a response within thirty (30) days of its receipt and to have that response filed in the permanent file.
At any time during the investigative or hearing processes, the board may accept an assurance of voluntary compliance from the licensee if the assurance effectively deals with the complaint.
The board may reconsider, modify, or reverse its probation, suspension, or other disciplinary action.
Any party aggrieved by a disciplinary action of the board may bring an action in Franklin Circuit Court pursuant to the provisions of KRS Chapter 13B.
A license shall be subject to expiration and renewal during any period in which the license is suspended.

law.history: Created 2002 Ky. Acts ch. 269, sec. 12, effective July 15, 2002.
